title: Mustard-dill sauce

ingredients.content: 25 g Dijon mustard or other medium hot mustard

preparations.content: Place a jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh rapeseed oil into jug and set aside.
Place dill in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar, white wine vinegar, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, sweet mustard, egg yolk, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.
Mix on <b>speed 3<b> while very slowly pouring oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion.
Add reserved chopped dill and mix <b>8 sec//speed 3<b>, Transfer to a bottle or jar and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve cold.

hintsAndTricks: Serve this sauce with salmon (e.g. gravlax) or boiled eggs.
Instead of rapeseed oil use another neutral oil (e.g. sunflower oil).
